SHORT_DESCR.P: Zero Waste Scotland wishes to establish a Framework Agreement to provide print, fulfilment and warehousing services to support the development and delivery of effective communication.

TITLE.P: Storage, Stock Management and Distribution Services

MAIN_SITE.P: Main site will be the Suppliers proposed storage facility. Sites outwith Scotland will be considered where it can be demonstrated they offer value for money.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Zero Waste Scotland requires “fulfilment and warehousing” service for the storage and management of the stock of corporate publications, communication materials and items, and for the safe and secure distribution of those publications / materials / items on a call off basis to a stated location or locations thereafter, with collection and return to storage as appropriate.

The service should provide and maintain a catalogue of all stock held on behalf of Zero Waste Scotland, and be capable of distributing materials to a specified location or locations as requested, as well as collecting from same where appropriate.
Full details are provided in the Tender document.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: An option 12-month extension, subject to satisfactory performance and continued business need.

INFO_ADD.P: Economic operators may be excluded from this competition if they are in any of the situations referred to in regulation 58 of the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015.

MAIN_SITE.P: Delivery of services will be from the Suppliers main site or site offered for the purposes of this framework.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Zero Waste Scotland requires a 'print on demand' service for the production of printed materials on a call off basis, and for the safe and secure distribution of those materials to a stated location of locations thereafter.

The service should provide quick turnaround times that will support our goal to reduce wastage and minimise storage, and should be supported by an easy-to-use ordering system and a robust quality control process.
Full details are provided in the Tender document.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: An optional 12-month extension, subject to satisfactory performance and continued business need.

INFO_ADD.P: Zero Waste Scotland anticipates appointing a single Supplier to each Lot – which may be the same Supplier in each instance – but reserves the right not to appoint any Supplier to any Lot where proposals do not demonstrate value for money.

Tenderers may bid for and be appointed to both Lots, subject to the outcome of the Tender evaluation process. Where bidding for both Lots, Tenderers must prepare separate Tender submissions in response. Tender submissions that pertain to, or contain information relating to both Lots may be deemed non-compliant and therefore ineligible for Tender evaluation.

ESPD (Scotland) responses will be evaluated using the method(s) described in the "Supporting Information: ESPD (Scotland)" document that accompanies this Tender. This document also contains information on expectations for responses to questions contained in the ESPD (Scotland) for this Tender.
The quality submission will be scored using the Scottish Government's recommended scoring convention, reproduced below:

4 - Excellent; Response is completely relevant and excellent overall. The response is comprehensive, unambiguous and demonstrates a thorough understanding of the requirement and provides details of how the requirement will be met in full.
3 - Good; Response is relevant and good. The response is sufficiently detailed to demonstrate a good understanding and provides details on how the requirements will be fulfilled.
2 - Acceptable; Response is relevant and acceptable. The response addresses a broad understanding of the requirement but may lack details on how the requirement will be fulfilled in certain areas.

1 - Poor; Response is partially relevant but generally poor. The response addresses some elements of the requirement but contains insufficient / limited detail or explanation to demonstrate how the requirement will be fulfilled.
0 - Unacceptable; Nile or inadequate response. Fails to demonstrate an ability to meet the requirement.
